paper.title: Phase-curve Evidence for an Atmosphere on TRAPPIST-1 b

core_question: Does JWST MIRI phase-curve spectroscopy of TRAPPIST-1 b support an atmospheric interpretation over a strict bare-rock/no-redistribution model?

datasets_or_cohorts.label: Observed TRAPPIST-1 b phase-curve
datasets_or_cohorts.sample_size_or_observations: One rocky exoplanet with phase-resolved JWST MIRI thermal spectra
datasets_or_cohorts.description: The study observes TRAPPIST-1 b with orbital phase-resolved thermal spectroscopy to constrain day-night heat transport and composition-sensitive spectral structure.

datasets_or_cohorts.label: No-atmosphere null model
datasets_or_cohorts.sample_size_or_observations: Same observational dataset modeled with atmosphere-free scenario
datasets_or_cohorts.description: A bare-rock, no-atmosphere model with minimal heat redistribution is used as a null comparison against atmospheric hypotheses.

datasets_or_cohorts.label: CO2-rich atmospheric retrieval
datasets_or_cohorts.sample_size_or_observations: Same phase-curve dataset under CO2-rich retrieval assumptions
datasets_or_cohorts.description: An atmospheric retrieval branch with significant CO2-related absorption near 15 Âµm is tested against the observed phase variation and spectrum.

datasets_or_cohorts.label: O2-rich atmospheric retrieval
datasets_or_cohorts.sample_size_or_observations: Same phase-curve dataset under O2-rich retrieval assumptions
datasets_or_cohorts.description: An oxidized atmospheric branch is examined for consistency with thermal and spectral constraints and is not fully rejected by the data.

major_limitations: Single-planet study: findings apply to TRAPPIST-1 b and do not establish prevalence across all M-dwarf rocky planets.
Retrieval assumptions (circulation, opacity priors, and cloud/haze treatment) strongly influence inferred posterior values.
Stellar variability and instrument systematics may bias weak spectral features in this dataset.
Night-side constraints are weaker than day-side constraints, reducing confidence in full thermal-map interpretation.
